H0.text: Circulatory is the human organ system that eliminates liquid and gaseous wastes from the body.

H1.text: Endocrine is the human organ system that eliminates liquid and gaseous wastes from the body.

H2.text: The excretory system is the human organ system that eliminates liquid and gaseous wastes from the body.

H3.text: The reproductive system eliminates liquid and gaseous wastes from the body.

A4.text: The dual function of excretory systems is the elimination of the waste products of metabolism and to drain the body of used up and broken down components in a liquid and gaseous state.

A5.text: In humans and other amniotes (mammals, birds and reptiles), most of these substances leave the body as urine and to some degree exhalation, mammals also expel them through sweating.
